content.description: Scraggles is a fun route to do if you are in the area! The route is great for the fledging OW leader as there are holds in the crack that make it forgiving.
content.location:
This route shares a start with

Brown Sugar

before breaking right into the offwidth.

content.description:
The Left Y Crack, AKA The Bush Crack, is located on the Rightovers.  To get to the Rightovers, head east from Turkey Tail.  Drop some elevation to go along the base of the next cliff band.  The Left Y Crack is unmistakable.  Just look for the crack that makes an obvious Y.

Steve Cheney describes the climb as a steep hand and finger crack, but he neglects to mention the obvious part.  The middle of the pitch has a gaping wide section.  Shove the number 5 in it and hope you are facing the right direction.  Otherwise it can be rather awkward to get back out of again. Setting an anchor on top is not too difficult.  The route can be top roped with a 200' rope easily.

Walk off to the west to get back down.  Enjoy.
content.protection: Bring a little bit of everyting from a #5 Camalot to some small stuff.

content.description:
Once you get above the tree, this route is terrific.

This route is the crack left of

Brown Sugar

, and has a small tree growing out of the crack halfway up it.  Based on the amount of dirt in the crack below the tree, no one does this route.

You could certainly climb this with gear, but if you fall on the no-pro 11c face that is before the dirt-filled crack below the small tree, my guess is that you would hit the ledge, roll off it, then fall to your death.  Which would be unfortunate since the 5.8 hand crack above the tree is such a pleasure. Great jams, good feet, a pleasure.
content.protection:
Climb

Brown Sugar

and set anchors with cams at the top.  It's easy to set up a good top rope. Then rap down to the ledge -- no problem with a 60m rope.  Work the 11c section or start

Brown Sugar

and do an exciting pendulum to the Gill crack.

content.description:
Easy Corner is a one pitch route in the Hubbel Guide.  It is a nice lead for learning.  Climb an easier crack with ledges up to the ledge below

Brown Sugar

and

Gill Route

.  Build an anchor here.  From here, continue up one of the other routes or downclimb the route.  We were low on daylight, therefore we climbed up

5.8 Start

and down climbed Easy Corner.
content.protection: Light rack up to a #4 Friend.
content.location:
Easy Corner is located on the lower section of the Rightovers below

Gill Route

and

Brown Sugar

(see photo).

To descend, either downclimb the route or continue up

Brown Sugar

or Scraggles to the top then walk/scramble off to climber's left.

content.description:
The Excellent Crack is located on the Rightovers. To get to the Rightovers, head east from Turkey Tail. Drop some elevation to go along the base of the next cliff band. The Excellent Crack is to the left of the

Left Y Crack

and just right of a large roof that has large, chopper-looking flakes hanging out of it.

Begin by climbing a face to the right of an obvious weakness through a roof.  Once through the roof, wander up twin cracks to the top. The left hand crack grows very large towards the top. Setting an anchor on top is not too difficult. The route can be top roped with a 200' rope easily.

Walk off to the west to get back down. Enjoy.
content.protection: Bring a little bit of everything. You won't feel dumb toting along the #5 Camalot.

content.description:
Brown Sugar is located on the Rightovers. To get to the Rightovers, head east from Turkey Tail. Drop some elevation to go along the base of the next cliff band. Brown Sugar is left of the

Left Y Crack

. Just look for the beautiful and steep finger crack bisecting the face above.  From a reasonable stance, get good gear in the finger crack and go for it.  Setting an anchor on top is not too difficult. The route can be top roped with a 200' rope easily. Walk off to the west to get back down. Enjoy.
content.protection: You won't need as much big gear on this finger crack as on other Turkey Rocks classics.

content.description:
5.8 Start is a one pitch route in the Hubbel Guide. Perhaps it was the first pitch for one of the routes above. Climb a hand and finger  crack with ledges up to the ledge below

Brown Sugar

and

Gill Route

. Build an anchor here. From here, continue up one of the other routes or down climb

Easy Corner

. We were low on daylight, therefore we climbed up this route and downclimbed

Easy Corner

.

It has a short crux with ample protection therefore a pretty good first 5.8 lead.
content.protection: Light rack up to a #4 Friend.
content.location:
5.8 Start is located on the lower section of the Rightovers below

Gill Route

and

Brown Sugar

(see photo).

To descend, either dow climb

Easy Corner

or continue up

Brown Sugar

or Scraggles to the top then walk/scramble off to climber's left.
